title: Add Indonesian (id) to language menu and UI translations

requirements.summary: Add Indonesian ("id") as a supported UI language, including a new selector option and complete translations for all existing UI translation keys.
acceptanceCriteria: The language selector dropdown includes an Indonesian option labeled "Bahasa Indonesia" with the Indonesia flag emoji (ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡©) and uses language code "id".

Selecting Indonesian updates all UI labels/buttons/messages that are driven by LanguageContext translations (e.g., titles, form labels/placeholders, View Feedback, PIN dialog strings, table headers, empty/error states).
TypeScript builds without errors and no components reference a missing translation key for the "id" language.
If a user selects Indonesian, the app does not crash and renders translated strings everywhere translations are used.

file_operations.description: Extend the Language union type to include "id" and add a complete Indonesian (id) translation map covering every existing translation key currently used by the UI. Tighten typings (e.g., using a shared TranslationKey type and Record<Language, Record<TranslationKey,string>>) so TypeScript enforces that "id" includes all required keys and prevents missing-key crashes.

Add a new language dropdown option for Indonesian using code "id", label "Bahasa Indonesia", and flag "ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡©". Ensure the option integrates with the existing Select control without modifying any files under frontend/src/components/ui.
